Uses of Class
org.apache.juneau.transform.BeanFilter

  • Packages that use BeanFilter 
    Package Description
    org.apache.juneau
    Base toolkit for serializers, parsers, and bean contexts
    org.apache.juneau.transform
    Transform API

    • Uses of BeanFilter in org.apache.juneau

      Fields in org.apache.juneau declared as BeanFilter 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected BeanFilter<? extends T> BeanMeta.transform
      Optional bean filter associated with the target class.
      Methods in org.apache.juneau that return BeanFilter 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected <T> BeanFilter BeanContext.findBeanFilter(Class<T> c)
      Returns the BeanFilter associated with the specified class, or null if there is no bean filter associated with the class.
      Constructors in org.apache.juneau with parameters of type BeanFilter 
      Constructor and Description
      BeanMeta(ClassMeta<T> classMeta, BeanContext ctx, BeanFilter<? extends T> transform)
      Constructor.

    • Uses of BeanFilter in org.apache.juneau.transform

      Subclasses of BeanFilter in org.apache.juneau.transform 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AnnotationBeanFilter<T>
      Bean filter constructed from a @Bean annotation found on a class.
      class  InterfaceBeanFilter<T>
      Simple bean filter that simply identifies a class to be used as an interface class for all child classes.
      Methods in org.apache.juneau.transform that return BeanFilter 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.addSubType(Class<?> c, String id)
      Convenience method for adding a single subtype in leu of using setSubTypes(LinkedHashMap) in one call.
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.setExcludeProperties(String... excludeProperties)
      Specifies a list of properties to ignore on a bean.
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.setExcludeProperties(String excludeProperties)
      Same as setExcludeProperties(String[]) but pass in a comma-delimited list of values.
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.setInterfaceClass(Class<?> interfaceClass)
      Identifies a class to be used as the interface class for this and all subclasses.
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.setProperties(String... properties)
      Specifies the set and order of names of properties associated with a bean class.
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.setProperties(String properties)
      Same as setProperties(String[]) but pass in a comma-delimited list of values.
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.setPropertyNamer(Class<? extends PropertyNamer> propertyNamer)
      Associates a PropertyNamer with this bean to tailor the names of the bean properties.
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.setSortProperties(boolean sortProperties)
      Specifies whether the properties on this bean should be ordered alphabetically.
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.setStopClass(Class<?> stopClass)
      Identifies a stop class for this class and all subclasses.
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.setSubTypeProperty(String subTypeAttr)
      Defines a virtual property on a superclass that identifies bean subtype classes.
      BeanFilter<T> BeanFilter.setSubTypes(LinkedHashMap<Class<?>,String> subTypes)
      Specifies the set of subclasses of this bean class in addition to a string identifier for that subclass.
